comments:
I launch eclipse with -data "c:\dev". Eclipse fails with a NoClassDefFoundError
(see trace below). When I try to start it without the -data parameter, it works,
so I'm pretty sure the install is OK.
I thought it might be a problem with something in the .metadata directory, so I
deleted it (after making a backup :) and got the same result.

Yes, c:/dev is writable -- I've been using it as my workspace for several builds
now. I was using the 3.0M2 download when I had the problem. I've switched back
to M1 and it works fine. I'm using Java 1.4.2 (from Sun).
Could not reproduce.  Pleas reopen if it continues to happen with future builds.
